events.name: playingchange
events.summary: Fired when the currently playing media item changes.
events.description: See nowPlaying to identify the current media item.

events.name: statechange
events.summary: Fired when the music player's playback state changes.
events.description: See playbackState to identify the current playback state.

methods.name: pause
methods.summary: Pauses playback of the current media item.

methods.name: play
methods.summary: Begins playback of the current media item.

methods.name: seekBackward
methods.summary: Begins seeking backward in the currently playing media.
methods.description:
Seeking speed increases as seeking continues.

Call stopSeeking to return to normal play.

methods.name: seekForward
methods.summary: Begins seeking forward in the currently playing media item.
methods.description:
While seeking forward audio plays faster than usual. The speed increases as seeking continues.

Call stopSeeking to return to normal play.

methods.name: setQueue
methods.description:
Sets the media queue to a single media item or a list of items.

Starting in Titanium 6.1.0 you can also pass a String that identifies the Media item. This string has to be the persistentID property that identifies a media item uniquely.

methods.name: skipToBeginning
methods.summary: Skips to the beginning of the currently playing media item.

methods.name: skipToNext
methods.summary: Skips to the next media item in the queue.
methods.description: If there are no more media items in the queue, ends playback.

methods.name: skipToPrevious
methods.summary: Skips to the previous media item in the queue.
methods.description: If there are no previous media items in the queue, ends playback.

methods.name: stop
methods.summary: Stops playback of the current media queue.

methods.name: stopSeeking
methods.summary:
Ends a seek operation and returns to the previous playback state.

See also: seekForward and seekBackward.

properties.name: currentPlaybackTime
properties.summary: Current point in song playback, in seconds.
properties.description: This property is read/write, so you can update the music player's current position by setting this property.

properties.name: nowPlaying
properties.summary: An Item object representing the currently playing media item.
